comments:
Eclipse 2.0.2 ships with a version of externaltools.jar that seems to be out 
of sync with the Eclipse 2.0.2 source in CVS.

In particular, the file:
  plugins\org.eclipse.ui.externaltools_2.0.1\externaltools.jar

is part of the 2.0.2 release.  It contains the file AntFileRunner.class. This 
file seems to correspond to the 2.0.1 version of AntFileRunner.java.

Among other things, this means that bug 23340 is not fixed in the 2.0.2 
release.

Using 2.0.2 I cannot reproduce the bug 23340 and along with the source 
contained with the build, AntFileRunner is the correct version.

Do you have a particular build file that causes a problem on 2.0.2?

Note that it is unlikely that any fixes will occur in the 2.0.* stream.
I would recommend checking out the 2.1 stream as the external tools / ant 
framework has been completely reworked.

This seems to depend on how 2.0.2 is installed.

If I do a clean installation of 2.0.2, it works fine.

If I start with a clean installation of 2.0, I don't
see bug 23340 (since it was introduced in 2.0.1).
If I then select "Help / Software Updates / New Updates"
from the eclipse menu, and upgrade to 2.0.2, I see
bug 23340.  Here's the traceback I get:

The ant file itself seems to be irrelevant, but I am specifying a
working directory of: ${project_loc}

This is on a Windows XP system.

I haven't yet diffed the two installations to see what's different between
them.
I was doing a clean install.

ships an improper version of the JAR ? If so this is a releng issue (or build)
If it means Update Manager causes the issue, can you please elaborate ? TIA

If one installs 2.0 and then uses the update manager ("Help / Software

JAR is installed (it appears to be the 2.0.1 version). The JAR in question is 
named org.eclipse.ui.externaltools_2.0.1.
As I have been unable to download 2.0, I have not been able to verify the 
update problem report from maxhearn@aol.com.

Action Taken: 
I have verified that
http://download.eclipse.org/updates/features/org.eclipse.platform_2.0.2.jar
contains links to 

   <plugin
         id="org.eclipse.ant.core"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="2.0.1">
   </plugin>


and 

   <plugin
         id="org.eclipse.ui.externaltools"
         download-size="0"
         install-size="0"
         version="2.0.1">
   </plugin>

Where is seems ANT team released version 2.0.2.

This means that updating to 2.0.2 using Update Manager will download Version
2.0.1 of the plug-ins instead of 2.0.2.

Can you change the Feature.xml in teh JAR ?
Action Plan : Pass to releng

The current state of externaltools.jar seems pretty confused to me.

If you download 2.0.2 directly, the file:
  org.eclipse.ui.externaltools_2.0.1/externaltools.jar
contains a version of AntFileRunner.class that appears to correspond to the 
2.0.2 version of the source. Shouldn't this be in a file called
  org.eclipse.ui.externaltools_2.0.2/externaltools.jar

On a related note, if you upgrade from 2.0 to 2.0.2, the file:
  org.eclipse.ui.externaltools_2.0.1/externaltools.jar
contains a version of AntFileRunner.class that appears to correspond to the 
2.0.1 version of the source.  That's OK I think, but shouldn't there also be a 
file called:
  org.eclipse.ui.externaltools_2.0.2/externaltools.jar
that contains the 2.0.2 version?

So this is what is going on.

For the 2.0.2 release the external tools team released a new version of source 
code to the build but did not update their plugin.xml.

The result is a 2.0.1 "version" of the plugin was built with the new source 
code.

However, since the update site already contains a 2.0.1 plugin from version 
2.0.1, this is what you get when you attempt an upgrade.

It would appear the following is the correct course of action:

    1) Fix the plugin.xml org.eclipse.ui.externaltools and rev the version to 
2.0.2
    2)Update the org.eclipse.platform-feature to rev the plugin version for 
externaltools.
    3)Rebuild 2.0.2
    4) Replace the download on eclipse.org drops page with new 2.0.2.  
Essentially same drop but the externaltools plugin will now be labeled 
correctly as 2.0.2
    5) Put the new feauture and plugin jars on the update site.

This will fix new people that download 2.0.2 directly *and* new people that 
upgrade 2.0.1 to 2.0.2.  However, I think people that have already used the 
update site to go to 2.0.2 are still broken.

I don't see any way of fixing the people that have already used update manager 
to go to 2.0.2 ... unless we issue a 2.0.3 build which is not something I 
terribly keen on doing.







the external Tools folks released a new version of source code that got built 
into the jar.  However, sine they did not update their plugin.xml to a 2.0.2 
version this new jar got built into the 2.0.1 plugin.

2.0.2 is already done and rebuilding it is not an option. An official fix for 
this will have to be part of 2.0.3.

For now, steps to workaround the problem need to be communicated.
Closing given the availability of newer releases.
